condition.description:
Almost everyone has had a headache. Headache is the most common form of pain. It's a major reason people miss days at work or school or visit the doctor.

The most common type of headache is a tension headache. Tension headaches are due to tight muscles in your shoulders, neck, scalp and jaw. They are often related to stress, depression or anxiety. You are more likely to get tension headaches if you work too much, don't get enough sleep, miss meals, or use alcohol.

Other common types of headaches include migraines, cluster headaches, and sinus headaches. Most people can feel much better by making lifestyle changes, learning ways to relax and taking pain relievers.

Not all headaches require a doctor's attention. But sometimes headaches warn of a more serious disorder. Let your health care provider know if you have sudden, severe headaches. Get medical help right away if you have a headache after a blow to your head, or if you have a headache along with a stiff neck, fever, confusion, loss of consciousness, or pain in the eye or ear.

NIH: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke
condition.name: Tension headache

carousel_items: Take Fioricet as soon as your headache starts, then lie down in a dark room to help ease the pain.
Be sure to take each dose with a full glass of water.
Take your time getting up from sitting or lying down while taking Fioricet to decrease your chances of feeling dizzy.
Be sure to limit how much caffeine and chocolate you take while on Fioricet since it can cause nervousness, shakiness, and a fast heartbeat.
While taking Fioricet, don’t drink alcohol or take other drugs that slow your body down.
Don't take other forms of acetaminophen (Tylenol) while taking Fioricet, since taking too much can lead to liver problems.

basics.benefits_moa: Fioricet is a combination of three medications. Butalbital is a barbiturate that relaxes you. Acetaminophen relieves pain, and caffeine narrows the blood vessels that otherwise cause headaches.
basics.bottom_line: Fioricet works well for tension headaches, but isn’t recommended due to the ability to overuse it and have withdrawal symptoms.
downsides: Fioricet isn't the first choice medication for treating tension headaches.
It's not a good medication for long-term use.
Overuse of Fioricet can lead to chronic tension headaches.
Fioricet can cause dangerous withdrawal symptoms, intoxication, and dependence.
Taking Fioricet can decrease your ability to drive a car, or operate machinery.

downsides_processed.orig: Fioricet isn't the first choice medication for treating tension headaches.
It's not a good medication for long-term use.
Overuse of Fioricet can lead to chronic tension headaches.
Fioricet can cause dangerous withdrawal symptoms, intoxication, and dependence.
Taking Fioricet can decrease your ability to drive a car, or operate machinery.

upsides: Fioricet works better and faster in treating tension headaches than the combination of acetaminophen and codeine.
Fioricet doesn’t cost much since it's available as a generic medication.
Fioricet has very few side effects.
It has been widely used for a long time.

upsides_processed.orig: Fioricet works better and faster in treating tension headaches than the combination of acetaminophen and codeine.
Fioricet doesn’t cost much since it's available as a generic medication.
Fioricet has very few side effects.
It has been widely used for a long time.

drugs.name: Fioricet

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Fioricet as soon as your headache starts, then lie down in a dark room to help ease the pain.
Be sure to take each dose with a full glass of water.
Take your time getting up from sitting or lying down while taking Fioricet to decrease your chances of feeling dizzy.
Be sure to limit how much caffeine and chocolate you take while on Fioricet since it can cause nervousness, shakiness, and a fast heartbeat.
While taking Fioricet, don’t drink alcohol or take other drugs that slow your body down.
Don't take other forms of acetaminophen (Tylenol) while taking Fioricet, since taking too much can lead to liver problems.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Fioricet contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP. Taking too much acetaminophen causes liver damage that can be permanent and life-threatening. Using more than 3000 mg of the acetaminophen can cause serious harm to your liver, so be sure not to take more than the recommended dose of Fioricet or other medications that contain acetaminophen.
risk_factors: Drinking more than 2 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Fioricet contains acetaminophen, also known as Tylenol or APAP. Taking too much acetaminophen causes liver damage that can be permanent and life-threatening. Using more than 3000 mg of the acetaminophen can cause serious harm to your liver, so be sure not to take more than the recommended dose of Fioricet or other medications that contain acetaminophen.

risks_warnings.title: Hypersensitivity (allergic) reactions
risks_warnings.description: Fioricet can cause a serious allergic reactions like skin rash, fever, swelling and trouble breathing. While this is rare, it is a life-threatening emergency. Get medical help right away.

carousel_items: Take Maxalt as soon as you feel you’re getting a headache or experience warning signs like being sensitive to light or sound.
If you're taking other medicines to control your headaches (like propranolol), the dose of Maxalt will be different.
Let your doctor know if your headaches don’t go away after taking [name-common] or if you have more than 4 migraines per month.
It’s available in two different dosage forms, a tablet you take by mouth and an orally disintegrating tablet (Maxalt-MLT) you place on your tongue to let it dissolve.
Lie down in a dark room after taking Maxalt to help ease pain. Ask your doctor about other medicines that can help prevent your headaches.

basics.benefits_moa: Maxalt is a triptan medication that treats migraine headaches. It releases serotonin, which lowers the inflammation that causes headaches.
basics.bottom_line: Maxalt is great for relieving short migraines, but doesn't work as well for long-lasting headaches.
downsides: Maxalt doesn’t prevent migraines or tension headaches, but only works once the headache starts.
It can cause rebound headaches if it’s used too often.
You need to wait at least 2 hours after your first dose to take a second dose.
May not be the best choice if you have long, drawn-out headaches. Ask your doctor about other triptans that can last longer than Maxalt.
Not a good choice if you have heart disease or if you’re pregnant or breast-feeding.

downsides_processed.orig: Maxalt doesn’t prevent migraines or tension headaches, but only works once the headache starts.
It can cause rebound headaches if it’s used too often.
You need to wait at least 2 hours after your first dose to take a second dose.
May not be the best choice if you have long, drawn-out headaches. Ask your doctor about other triptans that can last longer than Maxalt.
Not a good choice if you have heart disease or if you’re pregnant or breast-feeding.

upsides: Triptans like Maxalt are considered the first-choice treatment to relieve moderate to severe migraine-type headaches.
It can also be used to treat tension-type headaches.
Not all triptans work the same way for people, so you can try multiple ones to find the right medication for you.
You don't need to drink water with the orally disintegrating tablet for it to work, so this could be a good medication for people who can't keep water down when they have a migraine.

upsides_processed.orig: Triptans like Maxalt are considered the first-choice treatment to relieve moderate to severe migraine-type headaches.
It can also be used to treat tension-type headaches.
Not all triptans work the same way for people, so you can try multiple ones to find the right medication for you.
You don't need to drink water with the orally disintegrating tablet for it to work, so this could be a good medication for people who can't keep water down when they have a migraine.

userStories.tip: Insurance companies only allow migraineurs 2 headaches per week, even with the generic.
I've taken several triptans and this is the only one that makes headache/nausea/pain worse, much worse!
I only take it occasionally for migraines, and the first few times I took it, it worked great with just 1 pill! Now takes 2-3 pills to relieve the migraine fully.

drugs.name: Maxalt

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Maxalt as soon as you feel you’re getting a headache or experience warning signs like being sensitive to light or sound.
If you're taking other medicines to control your headaches (like propranolol), the dose of Maxalt will be different.
Let your doctor know if your headaches don’t go away after taking [name-common] or if you have more than 4 migraines per month.
It’s available in two different dosage forms, a tablet you take by mouth and an orally disintegrating tablet (Maxalt-MLT) you place on your tongue to let it dissolve.
Lie down in a dark room after taking Maxalt to help ease pain. Ask your doctor about other medicines that can help prevent your headaches.

risks_warnings.title: Tightening of blood vessels (myocardial angina, ischemia, or infarction)
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Maxalt have reported temporary chest pain, pressure, and tightness. These symptoms are caused by heart vessels being constricted/tightened. Before starting Maxalt, people who have coronary artery disease, or are more likely to have it, should talk to their doctor about having a heart health assessment.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Maxalt have reported temporary chest pain, pressure, and tightness. These symptoms are caused by heart vessels being constricted/tightened. Before starting Maxalt, people who have coronary artery disease, or are more likely to have it, should talk to their doctor about having a heart health assessment.

risks_warnings.title: Stroke
risks_warnings.description: Taking Maxalt can also increase your chances of a stroke. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before starting Maxalt.

description_processed.orig: Taking Maxalt can also increase your chances of a stroke. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before starting Maxalt.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Taking Maxalt can cause a constriction of the blood vessels in your digestive tract. If you have unusual stomach pain or bloody diarrhea while taking Maxalt, be sure to seek medical attention.

description_processed.orig: Taking Maxalt can cause a constriction of the blood vessels in your digestive tract. If you have unusual stomach pain or bloody diarrhea while taking Maxalt, be sure to seek medical attention.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Taking Maxalt along with medications used for your mood, such as monoamine oxidase inhibitors and certain antidepressants, can make you more likely to have a serious condition called serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include sudden changes in your mental status (confusion and hallucinations), muscles (tremors and rigidity), and nausea or diarrhea. Go to the emergency room or talk to your doctor immediately if you notice these symptoms. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you are unsure if your other medications will interact with Maxalt.

description_processed.orig: Taking Maxalt along with medications used for your mood, such as monoamine oxidase inhibitors and certain antidepressants, can make you more likely to have a serious condition called serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include sudden changes in your mental status (confusion and hallucinations), muscles (tremors and rigidity), and nausea or diarrhea. Go to the emergency room or talk to your doctor immediately if you notice these symptoms. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you are unsure if your other medications will interact with Maxalt.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Maxalt works by narrowing the blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure. If you feel dizzy or have a headache that won't go away, Maxalt may not be the best option for you.

description_processed.orig: Maxalt works by narrowing the blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure. If you feel dizzy or have a headache that won't go away, Maxalt may not be the best option for you.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Maxalt can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Seizures can make a person shake uncontrollably for a few seconds and zone out. Get medical help right away if you notice this.

description_processed.orig: Maxalt can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Seizures can make a person shake uncontrollably for a few seconds and zone out. Get medical help right away if you notice this.

risks_warnings.title: Phenylketonuria (PKU)
risks_warnings.description: Maxalt orally disintegrating tablet (Maxalt-MLT) contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU don't take the orally disintegrating tablet. You can still take the oral swallow tablet.

description_processed.orig: Maxalt orally disintegrating tablet (Maxalt-MLT) contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU don't take the orally disintegrating tablet. You can still take the oral swallow tablet.

carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
May cause hair loss and weight gain.
Different versions of Depakote have different dosing. Be careful.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes 3 to 4 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Depakote is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to increase the amount of GABA, a chemical that calms nerves in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Depakote is good long-term prevention for epilepsy, bipolar disorder, and migraines, but can cause weight gain.
downsides: Can cause upset stomach, hair loss, weight gain, sleepiness, and tremor.
Can cause liver damage, so it's probably not safe if you already have liver problems.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause upset stomach, hair loss, weight gain, sleepiness, and tremor.
Can cause liver damage, so it's probably not safe if you already have liver problems.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with absence, tonic-clonic, and complex partial seizures.
One of the first-line options to stabilize mood for people with bipolar disorder.
Helpful in preventing frequent migraine headaches.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with absence, tonic-clonic, and complex partial seizures.
One of the first-line options to stabilize mood for people with bipolar disorder.
Helpful in preventing frequent migraine headaches.

userStories.tip: It caused me to gain 15 pounds in a month and gave me headaches. I

Noticeable weight gain around my gut. Had to start dieting and running on tread mill to combat the weight gain. Did not eliminate migraines, but made them less frequent and less intense. Now I can usually knock them out with a sumatriptan.

Causes major hair loss, "brain fog," drains your motivation...not worth it, especially the short-acting formula (valproic acid - Depakene).  Ironically, it GAVE me migraines, instead of preventing them (one of its purported purposes.)
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: shaky hands, hair loss, memory loss and felt sleepy all day. It worked for my epilepsy, but i hate those side effects

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: The side effects can be extreme: hand tremors, weight gain, memory issues, and others.

drugs.name: Depakote

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
May cause hair loss and weight gain.
Different versions of Depakote have different dosing. Be careful.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes 3 to 4 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

risks_warnings.title: Pancreatitis
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to high ammonia
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Low body temperature
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.
